articles.title: Norwegian Daily Conversations for Couples
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Living with a Norwegian partner means cozy mornings, outdoor adventures, and plenty of opportunities to practice this beautiful Scandinavian language. This guide covers all the essential phrases for your daily life together.

## Start the Day Right

<PhraseOfDay
  word="God morgen, kj√¶re"
  translation="Good morning, dear"
  pronunciation="goo MOR-en, SHARE-e"
  context="The sweetest way to start each day with your Norwegian partner."
/>

### Morning Greetings

<VocabCard
  word="Hvordan sov du?"
  translation="How did you sleep?"
  pronunciation="VOR-dan soov doo?"
  example="Ask your partner about their night."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jeg sov godt"
  translation="I slept well"
  pronunciation="yai soov got"
  example="Responding to the question."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jeg hadde en fin dr√∏m"
  translation="I had a nice dream"
  pronunciation="yai HA-de en feen drum"
  example="Share your dreams!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Vil du ha kaffe?"
  translation="Would you like coffee?"
  pronunciation="vil doo ha KA-fe?"
  example="Offer your partner their morning drink."
/>

<CultureTip title="Norwegian Coffee Culture" flag="üá≥üá¥">
Norway has one of the highest coffee consumption rates in the world! Morning coffee is a sacred ritual. Many couples enjoy their first cup together, often with a simple breakfast. It's the perfect time to connect before the day begins.
</CultureTip>

## Breakfast Time

<VocabCard
  word="Hva vil du ha til frokost?"
  translation="What would you like for breakfast?"
  pronunciation="va vil doo ha til FRO-kost?"
  example="Planning breakfast together."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jeg er sulten"
  translation="I'm hungry"
  pronunciation="yai air SOOL-ten"
  example="Express your hunger."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jeg lager frokost til deg"
  translation="I'll make you breakfast"
  pronunciation="yai LA-ger FRO-kost til dey"
  example="A sweet morning gesture."
/>

| Norwegian | Pronunciation | English |
|---------|---------------|---------|
| **Br√∏d** | brud | Bread |
| **Sm√∏r** | smur | Butter |
| **Syltet√∏y** | SOOL-te-tuy | Jam |
| **Egg** | eg | Eggs |
| **Yoghurt** | YOH-goort | Yogurt |
| **Kaffe** | KA-fe | Coffee |
| **Te** | tay | Tea |

## Leaving for Work

<VocabCard
  word="Jeg ma ga pa jobb"
  translation="I have to go to work"
  pronunciation="yai moh goh poh yob"
  example="Time to leave."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Nar kommer du hjem?"
  translation="When will you be home?"
  pronunciation="nohr KOM-er doo yem?"
  example="Planning your evening."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jeg er hjemme rundt seks"
  translation="I'll be home around six"
  pronunciation="yai air YEM-me roont seks"
  example="Answering the question."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Ha en fin dag!"
  translation="Have a nice day!"
  pronunciation="ha en feen dag!"
  example="A sweet farewell."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jeg kommer til a savne deg"
  translation="I'll miss you"
  pronunciation="yai KOM-er til oh SAV-ne dey"
  example="Express affection before parting."
/>

## During the Day - Texting

<VocabCard
  word="Hvordan gar dagen?"
  translation="How's your day going?"
  pronunciation="VOR-dan gohr DA-gen?"
  example="Check in with your partner."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jeg tenker pa deg"
  translation="I'm thinking of you"
  pronunciation="yai TEN-ker poh dey"
  example="A sweet midday message."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jeg gleder meg til a se deg"
  translation="I'm looking forward to seeing you"
  pronunciation="yai GLE-der mey til oh se dey"
  example="Express anticipation."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Hva har du lyst pa til middag?"
  translation="What would you like for dinner?"
  pronunciation="va har doo loost poh til mi-DAG?"
  example="Plan dinner together."
/>

<CultureTip title="Norwegian Work-Life Balance" flag="üá≥üá¥">
Norwegians value their personal time highly. The standard workday often ends at 4pm, leaving plenty of time for outdoor activities, family, and hygge (coziness). Your partner will likely appreciate quality time in the evening!
</CultureTip>

## Coming Home

<VocabCard
  word="Jeg er hjemme!"
  translation="I'm home!"
  pronunciation="yai air YEM-me!"
  example="Announce your arrival."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Hvordan var jobben?"
  translation="How was work?"
  pronunciation="VOR-dan var YOB-en?"
  example="Ask about their day."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Det var slitsomt"
  translation="It was tiring"
  pronunciation="det var SLIT-somt"
  example="Share about a hard day."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Kom hit, gi meg en klem"
  translation="Come here, give me a hug"
  pronunciation="kom heet, yee mey en klem"
  example="Welcome your partner home."
/>

## Evening Routine

### Dinner Time

<VocabCard
  word="Middagen er klar"
  translation="Dinner is ready"
  pronunciation="mi-DA-gen air klahr"
  example="Call your partner to eat."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Vel bekomme!"
  translation="Enjoy your meal!"
  pronunciation="vel be-KOM-me!"
  example="Say before eating."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Det er kjempegodt!"
  translation="It's very delicious!"
  pronunciation="det air SHEM-pe-got!"
  example="Compliment the cooking."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jeg tar oppvasken"
  translation="I'll do the dishes"
  pronunciation="yai tar OP-vas-ken"
  example="Offer to help clean up."
/>

### Relaxing Together

<VocabCard
  word="Hva skal vi gj√∏re i kveld?"
  translation="What shall we do this evening?"
  pronunciation="va skal vee YU-re ee kvell?"
  example="Plan your evening."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Skal vi se pa en film?"
  translation="Shall we watch a movie?"
  pronunciation="skal vee se poh en film?"
  example="Suggest a movie night."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Kom og sitt ved siden av meg"
  translation="Come and sit next to me"
  pronunciation="kom oh sit ved SEE-den av mey"
  example="Invite closeness."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Vi kan bare prate"
  translation="We can just talk"
  pronunciation="vee kan BA-re PRA-te"
  example="Quality time together."
/>

<CultureTip title="Norwegian Koselig" flag="üá≥üá¥">
"Koselig" is the Norwegian word for cozy/hygge. Winter evenings with candles, warm drinks, and your partner are quintessentially Norwegian. Create your own koselig moments - blankets, hot chocolate, and quality time together!
</CultureTip>

## Household Tasks

<VocabCard
  word="Kan du hjelpe meg?"
  translation="Can you help me?"
  pronunciation="kan doo YEL-pe mey?"
  example="Ask for assistance."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jeg ma rydde"
  translation="I need to clean"
  pronunciation="yai moh ROO-de"
  example="Household chores."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jeg gar og handler"
  translation="I'm going shopping"
  pronunciation="yai gohr oh HAN-dler"
  example="Running errands."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Vi trenger..."
  translation="We need..."
  pronunciation="vee TREN-ger..."
  example="Making a shopping list."
/>

| Norwegian | Pronunciation | English |
|---------|---------------|---------|
| **Vaske kl√¶r** | VAS-ke klahr | To do laundry |
| **St√∏vsuge** | STUV-soo-ge | To vacuum |
| **Lage mat** | LA-ge mat | To cook |
| **Ta oppvask** | ta OP-vask | To wash dishes |
| **Rydde** | ROO-de | To clean/tidy |

## Weekend Plans

<VocabCard
  word="Hva skal vi gj√∏re i helgen?"
  translation="What shall we do this weekend?"
  pronunciation="va skal vee YU-re ee HEL-gen?"
  example="Plan your weekend."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Skal vi ga ut?"
  translation="Shall we go out?"
  pronunciation="skal vee goh oot?"
  example="Suggest going out."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Vi kunne..."
  translation="We could..."
  pronunciation="vee KOO-ne..."
  example="Make suggestions."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Det h√∏res bra ut!"
  translation="That sounds good!"
  pronunciation="det HUR-es bra oot!"
  example="Agree enthusiastically."
/>

## Bedtime

<VocabCard
  word="Jeg er tr√∏tt"
  translation="I'm tired"
  pronunciation="yai air trut"
  example="Express tiredness."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Skal vi legge oss?"
  translation="Shall we go to bed?"
  pronunciation="skal vee LEG-e os?"
  example="Suggest bedtime."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="God natt, kj√¶re"
  translation="Good night, dear"
  pronunciation="goo nat, SHARE-e"
  example="Say goodnight sweetly."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Sov godt"
  translation="Sleep well"
  pronunciation="soov got"
  example="Wish them good sleep."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Dr√∏m s√∏tt"
  translation="Sweet dreams"
  pronunciation="drum sut"
  example="Before falling asleep."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jeg elsker deg"
  translation="I love you"
  pronunciation="yai EL-sker dey"
  example="The perfect way to end the day."
/>

## Quick Reference: Daily Phrases

### Morning
| Norwegian | English |
|---------|---------|
| God morgen | Good morning |
| Hvordan sov du? | How did you sleep? |
| Vil du ha kaffe? | Want coffee? |
| Ha en fin dag | Have a nice day |

### During the Day
| Norwegian | English |
|---------|---------|
| Jeg tenker pa deg | Thinking of you |
| Hvordan gar dagen? | How's your day? |
| Jeg gleder meg til deg | Looking forward to you |
| Nar kommer du hjem? | When will you be home? |

### Evening
| Norwegian | English |
|---------|---------|
| Jeg er hjemme | I'm home |
| Hvordan var jobben? | How was work? |
| Vel bekomme | Enjoy your meal |
| Hva skal vi gj√∏re? | What shall we do? |

### Night
| Norwegian | English |
|---------|---------|
| Jeg er tr√∏tt | I'm tired |
| God natt | Good night |
| Sov godt | Sleep well |
| Jeg elsker deg | I love you |

<CTA />

articles.title: Spanish First Date Phrases for English Speakers
articles.content:
First dates are exciting and nerve-wracking. When your date speaks Spanish, knowing key phrases shows effort and creates connection. Here are essential Spanish phrases to help you shine on that first date.

## Making a Great First Impression

### Est√°s muy guapo/guapa
**Pronunciation:** ehs-TAHS mwee GWAH-poh/GWAH-pah

**Meaning:** "You look very handsome/beautiful"

**When to use it:** When greeting your date. Use "guapo" for men, "guapa" for women.

### Encantado/Encantada de conocerte
**Pronunciation:** ehn-kahn-TAH-doh/dah deh koh-noh-SEHR-teh

**Meaning:** "Delighted to meet you"

**When to use it:** A charming way to greet your date.

### Gracias por quedar conmigo
**Pronunciation:** GRAH-syahs pohr keh-DAHR kohn-MEE-goh

**Meaning:** "Thanks for meeting with me"

**When to use it:** To show appreciation for their time.

## Getting to Know Each Other

### ¬øA qu√© te dedicas?
**Pronunciation:** ah keh teh deh-DEE-kahs

**Meaning:** "What do you do (for work)?"

**When to use it:** A common conversation starter.

### ¬øQu√© te gusta hacer en tu tiempo libre?
**Pronunciation:** keh teh GOOS-tah ah-SEHR ehn too TYEHM-poh LEE-breh

**Meaning:** "What do you like to do in your free time?"

**When to use it:** To learn about their interests.

### ¬øDe d√≥nde eres?
**Pronunciation:** deh DOHN-deh EH-rehs

**Meaning:** "Where are you from?"

**When to use it:** To learn about their background.

### Cu√©ntame m√°s sobre ti
**Pronunciation:** KWEHN-tah-meh mahs SOH-breh tee

**Meaning:** "Tell me more about yourself"

**When to use it:** To invite them to share more.

## Expressing Interest

### Me encanta hablar contigo
**Pronunciation:** meh ehn-KAHN-tah ah-BLAHR kohn-TEE-goh

**Meaning:** "I love talking with you"

**When to use it:** To show you're enjoying the conversation.

### Tienes una sonrisa preciosa
**Pronunciation:** TYEH-nehs OO-nah sohn-REE-sah preh-SYOH-sah

**Meaning:** "You have a beautiful smile"

**When to use it:** A sincere compliment.

### Me haces re√≠r
**Pronunciation:** meh AH-sehs reh-EER

**Meaning:** "You make me laugh"

**When to use it:** When they're funny and charming.

## During the Date

### ¬øQu√© quieres tomar/comer?
**Pronunciation:** keh KYEH-rehs toh-MAHR/koh-MEHR

**Meaning:** "What would you like to drink/eat?"

**When to use it:** When ordering.

### Esto est√° delicioso
**Pronunciation:** EHS-toh ehs-TAH deh-lee-SYOH-soh

**Meaning:** "This is delicious"

**When to use it:** To compliment the food or drink.

### La estoy pasando muy bien
**Pronunciation:** lah ehs-TOY pah-SAHN-doh mwee byehn

**Meaning:** "I'm having a great time"

**When to use it:** To express enjoyment.

## Ending the Date

### Me gustar√≠a volver a verte
**Pronunciation:** meh goos-tah-REE-ah vohl-VEHR ah VEHR-teh

**Meaning:** "I'd like to see you again"

**When to use it:** When you want a second date.

### ¬øPodemos vernos otra vez?
**Pronunciation:** poh-DEH-mohs VEHR-nohs OH-trah vehs

**Meaning:** "Can we see each other again?"

**When to use it:** To ask for another date.

### Llegaste bien a casa?
**Pronunciation:** yeh-GAHS-teh byehn ah KAH-sah

**Meaning:** "Did you get home okay?"

**When to use it:** A thoughtful text after the date.

## Cultural Tips

Spanish-speaking cultures often value warmth and personal connection. Don't be afraid to be expressive and genuine.

Compliments are appreciated, but keep them respectful. Physical greetings (a kiss on the cheek or cheeks) are common in many Spanish-speaking cultures.

Showing genuine interest in their culture, family, and background makes a positive impression.

## Making It Memorable

Your effort to speak Spanish‚Äîeven imperfectly‚Äîshows care and respect. "El amor no tiene idioma, pero hablar el tuyo es un buen comienzo" (Love has no language, but speaking yours is a good start).

articles.title: Este Greaca Greu de √énva»õƒÉt? Ghid Sincer
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

# Este Greaca Greu de √énva»õƒÉt? Un Ghid Sincer

Daca te g√¢nde»ôti sƒÉ √Ænve»õi greacƒÉ pentru partenerul tƒÉu, probabil te-ai intrebat: "Este greacƒÉ chiar at√¢t de grea?" Raspunsul sincer este nuantat. Greaca are unele aspecte provocatoare, dar are »ôi multe caracteristici care o fac surprinzator de accesibila. Sa analizam.

<PhraseOfDay
  word="ŒúŒ±Œ∏Œ±ŒØŒΩœâ ŒµŒªŒªŒ∑ŒΩŒπŒ∫Œ¨"
  translation="Invat greacƒÉ"
  pronunciation="ma-THE-no e-li-ni-KA"
  context="O frazƒÉ de care vei fi mandru pe masura ce incepi calatoria cu greacƒÉ."
/>

## Alfabetul Grec: Nu Atat de Infricosator Cum Pare

Partea cea mai intimidanta a grecesti pentru incepatori este alfabetul. Dar iata un secret: **probabil »ôtii deja jumatate din el**.

<CultureTip title="Litere Grecesti pe Care le Cunosti Deja" flag="üá¨üá∑">
Multe litere grecesti sunt folosite in matematica, »ôtiinta »ôi fizica. Probabil recuno»ôti Alfa (Œë), Beta (Œí), Pi (Œ†), Sigma (Œ£) »ôi Omega (Œ©). Aceasta √Æ»õi oferƒÉ un avantaj!
</CultureTip>

Alfabetul grec are 24 de litere. Iata cele care par familiare:

| Greaca | Nume | Sunet | Familiar? |
|--------|------|-------|-----------|
| **Œë Œ±** | Alfa | "a" | Da |
| **Œí Œ≤** | Beta | "v" | Da (dar suna ca "v"!) |
| **Œï Œµ** | Epsilon | "e" | Da |
| **Œô Œπ** | Iota | "i" | Da |
| **Œö Œ∫** | Kappa | "k" | Da |
| **Œü Œø** | Omicron | "o" | Da |
| **Œ§ œÑ** | Tau | "t" | Da |

<VocabCard
  word="ŒëŒªœÜŒ¨Œ≤Œ∑œÑŒø"
  translation="Alfabet"
  pronunciation="al-FA-vi-to"
  example="ŒúŒ±Œ∏Œ±ŒØŒΩœâ œÑŒø ŒµŒªŒªŒ∑ŒΩŒπŒ∫œå Œ±ŒªœÜŒ¨Œ≤Œ∑œÑŒø."
/>

**Realitatea:** Majoritatea oamenilor pot √Ænva»õƒÉ sƒÉ citeasca alfabetul grec in 1-2 saptamani cu practicƒÉ regulatƒÉ. Este fonetic, asa ca odata ce cunosti literele, po»õi pronunta orice cuvant!

## Ce Face Greaca Provocatoare

### 1. Complexitatea Gramaticala

Greaca are caracteristici gramaticale diferite de rom√¢nƒÉ:

**Cazuri:** Greaca are patru cazuri (nominativ, genitiv, acuzativ, vocativ), ceea ce √ÆnseamnƒÉ ca substantivele isi schimba terminatiile in functie de rolul lor in propozitie.

**Conjugare Verbala:** Verbele grecesti se conjugƒÉ pentru persoana, numar, timp »ôi aspect. Vestea bunƒÉ? Modelele de conjugare sunt regulate »ôi previzibile.

**Genul Gramatical:** Fiecare substantiv este masculin, feminin sau neutru, iar adjectivele trebuie sƒÉ se potriveasca. (Aceasta ti se va pƒÉrea familiar din rom√¢nƒÉ!)

<VocabCard
  word="Œü Œ∫Œ±ŒªœåœÇ Œ¨ŒΩœÑœÅŒ±œÇ"
  translation="Barbatul bun"
  pronunciation="o ka-LOS AN-dras"
  example="Adjectiv masculin cu substantiv masculin."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Œó Œ∫Œ±ŒªŒÆ Œ≥œÖŒΩŒ±ŒØŒ∫Œ±"
  translation="Femeia bunƒÉ"
  pronunciation="i ka-LI ji-NE-ka"
  example="Adjectiv feminin cu substantiv feminin."
/>

### 2. Provocari de Pronuntie

Unele sunete grecesti nu existƒÉ in rom√¢nƒÉ:

- **Œì (gamma)** - Un sunet moale »ôi gutural "gh"
- **Œß (chi)** - Ca "h" din germana in "Bach"
- **Œî (delta)** - Ca "th" englezesc din "this"
- **Œò (theta)** - Ca "th" englezesc din "think"

<VocabCard
  word="ŒìŒ¨œÑŒ±"
  translation="Pisica"
  pronunciation="GA-ta"
  example="Practica sunetul moale 'gh': Œó Œ≥Œ¨œÑŒ± ŒºŒøœÖ ŒµŒØŒΩŒ±Œπ œåŒºŒøœÅœÜŒ∑."
/>

## Ce Face Greaca Mai Usoara Decat Crezi

### 1. Ortografie Fonetica

Odata ce ai √Ænva»õƒÉt alfabetul, ortografia greacƒÉ este complet fonetica. Spre deosebire de engleza, nu existƒÉ litere mute sau pronuntii neasteptate. Ce vezi este ce spui!

### 2. Vocabular Comun

Romana »ôi greacƒÉ impartasesc multe cuvinte prin latina »ôi greceste:

| Radacina Greaca | Cuvinte Romanesti |
|-----------------|-------------------|
| **œÜŒπŒªŒø-** (dragoste) | Filosofie, filantropie |
| **œÑŒ∑ŒªŒµ-** (departe) | Telefon, televiziune |
| **Œ≥œÅŒ±œÜ-** (a scrie) | Grafic, biografie |
| **ŒªŒøŒ≥-** (cuvant/studiu) | Biologie, psihologie |

<CultureTip title="Recunoasterea Cuvintelor" flag="üá¨üá∑">
Recunoasterea radacinilor grecesti in cuvintele romanesti te poate ajuta sƒÉ ghicesti semnificatiile. "Œ¶ŒπŒªŒøœÉŒøœÜŒØŒ±" (filosofie) √ÆnseamnƒÉ literal "dragoste pentru intelepciune" - œÜŒØŒªŒøœÇ (prieten/iubit) + œÉŒøœÜŒØŒ± (intelepciune).
</CultureTip>

### 3. FƒÉrƒÉ Sistem Tonal

Spre deosebire de mandarina sau vietnameza, greacƒÉ nu folose»ôte tonuri pentru a distinge semnificatiile. Un lucru mai pu»õin de care sƒÉ te ingrijorezi!

### 4. Modele Regulate

Desi gramaticƒÉ greacƒÉ are multe reguli, aceste reguli sunt consistente. Odata √Ænva»õƒÉt un model, il po»õi aplica pe scara larga.

## Comparatie de Dificultate

Conform Foreign Service Institute din SUA, greacƒÉ este o **limba de Categoria II**, care necesitƒÉ aproximativ **1.100 ore** de studiu pentru competenta profesionala. Aceasta o plaseaza:

- **Mai grea decat:** Spaniola, Franceza, Portugheza, Olandeza
- **Mai usoara decat:** Araba, Mandarina, Japoneza, Coreeana

Pentru fluenta conversationala cu partenerul tƒÉu, po»õi atinge o comunicare semnificativa mult mai repede - adesea in 6-12 luni de practicƒÉ constanta.

## Sfaturi pentru Cupluri Care √énva»õƒÉ Greaca Impreuna

<VocabCard
  word="ŒúŒ±Œ∏Œ±ŒØŒΩŒøœÖŒºŒµ ŒºŒ±Œ∂ŒØ"
  translation="√énva»õƒÉm impreuna"
  pronunciation="ma-THE-nu-me ma-ZI"
  example="ŒúŒ±Œ∏Œ±ŒØŒΩŒøœÖŒºŒµ ŒµŒªŒªŒ∑ŒΩŒπŒ∫Œ¨ ŒºŒ±Œ∂ŒØ!"
/>

### 1. √éncepe cu Alfabetul
Dedica prima saptamana stapanirii citirii. Folose»ôte cartonase, aplicatii sau scrie literele impreuna.

### 2. √énva»õƒÉ Fraze, Nu Doar Cuvinte
Frazele raman in memorie mai bine decat vocabularul izolat. √énva»õƒÉ "Œ£'Œ±Œ≥Œ±œÄœé" (te iubesc) ca unitate.

### 3. Practica Zilnic
Chiar »ôi 15 minute pe zi bat sesiunile ocazionale de o ora. Folose»ôte saluturile grecesti in fiecare dimineata.

### 4. Accepta Greselile
Partenerul tƒÉu grec va aprecia fiecare √Æncercare, chiar imperfecta. Grecilor le place c√¢nd strainii √ÆncearcƒÉ!

### 5. Folose»ôte-ti Partenerul ca Resursa
Vorbitorii nativi sunt cei mai buni profesori. Roaga-ti partenerul sƒÉ te corecteze bland »ôi sƒÉ explice nuantele.

## Verdictul

**Este greacƒÉ greu de √Ænva»õƒÉt?** Este moderat provocatoare pentru romani, dar absolut realizabila. Alfabetul pare intimidant dar se √Ænva»õƒÉ in saptamani. Gramatica are complexitate dar urmeaza modele.

Mai important, a √Ænva»õƒÉ greacƒÉ pentru cineva pe care il iubesti oferƒÉ o motivatie puternica care face provocƒÉrile sƒÉ merite. C√¢nd vei spune "Œ£'Œ±Œ≥Œ±œÄœé" partenerului tƒÉu grec in limba lui materna, tot efortul va deveni semnificativ.

<VocabCard
  word="ŒëŒæŒØŒ∂ŒµŒπ œÑŒøŒΩ Œ∫œåœÄŒø"
  translation="Merita efortul"
  pronunciation="a-KSI-zi ton KO-po"
  example="Œ§Œ± ŒµŒªŒªŒ∑ŒΩŒπŒ∫Œ¨ Œ±ŒæŒØŒ∂ŒøœÖŒΩ œÑŒøŒΩ Œ∫œåœÄŒø!"
/>

Cel mai bun moment sƒÉ incepi este acum. Partenerul tƒÉu a»ôteaptƒÉ sƒÉ te auda vorbind frumoasƒÉ lor limba.

<CTA />

articles.title: Expressions de Mariage en Espagnol : Guide Complet
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Le mariage est l'un des moments les plus magiques de la vie d'un couple. Si vous vous mariez dans un pays espagnolphone, ou si vous avez des invit√©s qui parlent espagnol, ce guide vous aidera √† ma√Ætriser tout le vocabulaire essentiel. D√©couvrez les expressions les plus importantes pour vivre pleinement ce jour sp√©cial en espagnol.

<PhraseOfDay
  word="¬øQuieres casarte conmigo?"
  translation="Veux-tu m'√©pouser ?"
  pronunciation="[prononciation]"
  context="La question la plus importante de votre vie - la demande en mariage"
/>

## Les Bases : F√©licitations aux Mari√©s

<VocabCard
  word="¬°Felicidades por tu boda!"
  translation="F√©licitations pour votre mariage !"
  pronunciation="[prononciation]"
  example="¬°Felicidades por tu boda! Que vivan felices para siempre!"
/>

### Expressions de F√©licitations

| Espagnol | Fran√ßais | Contexte |
|---------|----------|----------|
| ¬°Felicidades por tu boda! | F√©licitations pour votre mariage ! | Universel |
| Que vivan felices para siempre | Que vous viviez heureux pour toujours ! | Romantique |

<CultureTip title="Traditions de Mariage" flag="üá™üá∏">
Dans les pays espagnolphones, les traditions de mariage varient selon les r√©gions. Le toast aux mari√©s est un moment important de la c√©l√©bration o√π famille et amis partagent leurs v≈ìux de bonheur.
</CultureTip>

## Vocabulaire de la C√©r√©monie

<VocabCard
  word="S√≠, acepto"
  translation="Oui, je le veux"
  pronunciation="[prononciation]"
  example="Quand on lui a demand√©, il/elle a r√©pondu : 'S√≠, acepto'."
/>

### Les Participants au Mariage

| Espagnol | Fran√ßais |
|---------|----------|
| novia | la mari√©e |
| novio | le mari√© |
| dama de honor | demoiselle d'honneur |
| padrino | t√©moin du mari√© |
| boda | mariage |
| ceremonia | c√©r√©monie |
| recepci√≥n | r√©ception |
| luna de miel | lune de miel |

### Les √âl√©ments de la C√©r√©monie

| Espagnol | Fran√ßais |
|---------|----------|
| votos | v≈ìux de mariage |
| anillo de boda | alliance |
| ramo | bouquet |
| pasillo | all√©e centrale |
| altar | autel |
| velo | voile |
| pastel de boda | g√¢teau de mariage |
| primer baile | premi√®re danse |

<VocabCard
  word="anillo de boda"
  translation="alliance"
  pronunciation="[prononciation]"
  example="Les anillo de boda symbolisent l'amour √©ternel."
/>

## La Demande en Mariage

<PhraseOfDay
  word="¬øQuieres casarte conmigo?"
  translation="Veux-tu m'√©pouser ?"
  pronunciation="[prononciation]"
  context="La question la plus romantique"
/>

### Vocabulaire des Fian√ßailles

| Espagnol | Fran√ßais |
|---------|----------|
| propuesta | demande en mariage |
| compromiso | fian√ßailles |
| prometida | fianc√©(e) |

<CultureTip title="La Demande en Mariage" flag="üá™üá∏">
La demande en mariage est un moment unique. En espagnol, la phrase traditionnelle "¬øQuieres casarte conmigo?" est souvent accompagn√©e de rituels romantiques comme mettre un genou √† terre.
</CultureTip>

## Messages pour Cartes de Mariage

<VocabCard
  word="Que vivan felices para siempre"
  translation="Que vous viviez heureux pour toujours"
  pronunciation="[prononciation]"
  example="Message parfait pour une carte de mariage."
/>

### Formules de V≈ìux

- **¬°Felicidades por tu boda!** - F√©licitations pour votre mariage !
- **Que vivan felices para siempre** - Que vous viviez heureux pour toujours !

## La R√©ception

### Vocabulaire de la F√™te

| Espagnol | Fran√ßais |
|---------|----------|
| recepci√≥n | r√©ception |
| pastel de boda | g√¢teau de mariage |
| primer baile | premi√®re danse |
| brindis | toast |
| ramo | bouquet |

<VocabCard
  word="brindis"
  translation="toast"
  pronunciation="[prononciation]"
  example="Le t√©moin a port√© un brindis aux mari√©s."
/>

## Pour Aller Plus Loin

Maintenant que vous ma√Ætrisez le vocabulaire du mariage en espagnol, pourquoi ne pas explorer d'autres expressions romantiques ? D√©couvrez nos guides sur les [expressions romantiques en espagnol](/fr/blog/spanish-romantic-phrases-for-every-occasion) ou les [petits noms affectueux](/fr/blog/spanish-pet-names-terms-of-endearment).

Que vous disiez "S√≠, acepto" bient√¥t ou que vous f√™tiez le mariage d'un proche, ces expressions vous permettront de partager pleinement la joie de ce moment unique.

articles.title: –ù—ñ–º–µ—Ü—å–∫—ñ —Ñ—Ä–∞–∑–∏ –ø—Ä–æ —Ä–µ–≤–Ω–æ—â—ñ —Ç–∞ –¥–æ–≤—ñ—Ä—É
articles.content:
–ù—ñ–º—Ü—ñ —Ü—ñ–Ω—É—é—Ç—å —á–µ—Å–Ω—ñ—Å—Ç—å —Ç–∞ –≤—ñ–¥–∫—Ä–∏—Ç—ñ—Å—Ç—å —É –æ–±–≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–µ–Ω–Ω—ñ –µ–º–æ—Ü—ñ–π. –¶–µ–π –ø–æ—Å—ñ–±–Ω–∏–∫ –¥–æ–ø–æ–º–æ–∂–µ –≤–∞–º –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç–∏ –ø—Ä–æ —Ä–µ–≤–Ω–æ—â—ñ —Ç–∞ –¥–æ–≤—ñ—Ä—É.

## –í–∏—Ä–∞–∂–µ–Ω–Ω—è —Ä–µ–≤–Ω–æ—â—ñ–≤

### "Ich bin eifers√ºchtig"
**–í–∏–º–æ–≤–∞:** –Ü—Ö –±—ñ–Ω –∞–π—Ñ–µ—Ä–∑—é—Ö—Ç—ñ—Ö

**–ó–Ω–∞—á–µ–Ω–Ω—è:** –Ø —Ä–µ–≤–Ω—É—é

### "Es macht mich eifers√ºchtig, wenn..."
**–í–∏–º–æ–≤–∞:** –ï—Å –º–∞—Ö—Ç –º—ñ—Ö –∞–π—Ñ–µ—Ä–∑—é—Ö—Ç—ñ—Ö, –≤–µ–Ω...

**–ó–Ω–∞—á–µ–Ω–Ω—è:** –ú–µ–Ω–µ –∑–º—É—à—É—î —Ä–µ–≤–Ω—É–≤–∞—Ç–∏, –∫–æ–ª–∏...

### "Manchmal f√ºhle ich mich unsicher"
**–í–∏–º–æ–≤–∞:** –ú–∞–Ω—Ö–º–∞–ª—å —Ñ—é–ª–µ —ñ—Ö –º—ñ—Ö —É–Ω–∑—ñ—Ö–µ—Ä

**–ó–Ω–∞—á–µ–Ω–Ω—è:** –Ü–Ω–æ–¥—ñ —è –≤—ñ–¥—á—É–≤–∞—é –Ω–µ–≤–ø–µ–≤–Ω–µ–Ω—ñ—Å—Ç—å

## –ó–∞–ø–∏—Ç–∞–Ω–Ω—è

### "Wer war das?"
**–í–∏–º–æ–≤–∞:** –í–µ—Ä –≤–∞—Ä –¥–∞—Å?

**–ó–Ω–∞—á–µ–Ω–Ω—è:** –•—Ç–æ —Ü–µ –±—É–≤/–±—É–ª–∞?

### "Woher kennst du ihn/sie?"
**–í–∏–º–æ–≤–∞:** –í–æ—Ö–µ—Ä –∫–µ–Ω–Ω—Å—Ç –¥—É —ñ–Ω/–∑—ñ?

**–ó–Ω–∞—á–µ–Ω–Ω—è:** –ó–≤—ñ–¥–∫–∏ —Ç–∏ –π–æ–≥–æ/—ó—ó –∑–Ω–∞—î—à?

### "Sollte ich mir Sorgen machen?"
**–í–∏–º–æ–≤–∞:** –ó–æ–ª–ª—Ç–µ —ñ—Ö –º—ñ—Ä –∑–æ—Ä“ë–µ–Ω –º–∞—Ö–µ–Ω?

**–ó–Ω–∞—á–µ–Ω–Ω—è:** –ú–µ–Ω—ñ –≤–∞—Ä—Ç–æ —Ö–≤–∏–ª—é–≤–∞—Ç–∏—Å—è?

## –î–æ–≤—ñ—Ä–∞ —Ç–∞ –∑–∞—Å–ø–æ–∫–æ—î–Ω–Ω—è

### "Ich vertraue dir vollkommen"
**–í–∏–º–æ–≤–∞:** –Ü—Ö —Ñ–µ—Ä—Ç—Ä–∞—É–µ –¥—ñ—Ä —Ñ–æ–ª—å–∫–æ–º–º–µ–Ω

**–ó–Ω–∞—á–µ–Ω–Ω—è:** –Ø –ø–æ–≤–Ω—ñ—Å—Ç—é —Ç–æ–±—ñ –¥–æ–≤—ñ—Ä—è—é

### "Es gibt keinen Grund zur Sorge"
**–í–∏–º–æ–≤–∞:** –ï—Å “ë—ñ–±—Ç –∫–∞–π–Ω–µ–Ω “ë—Ä—É–Ω–¥ —Ü—É—Ä –∑–æ—Ä“ë–µ

**–ó–Ω–∞—á–µ–Ω–Ω—è:** –ù–µ–º–∞—î –ø—Ä–∏—á–∏–Ω –¥–ª—è –∑–∞–Ω–µ–ø–æ–∫–æ—î–Ω–Ω—è

### "Das ist nur ein Freund/eine Freundin"
**–í–∏–º–æ–≤–∞:** –î–∞—Å —ñ—Å—Ç –Ω—É—Ä –∞–π–Ω —Ñ—Ä–æ–π–Ω–¥/–∞–π–Ω–µ —Ñ—Ä–æ–π–Ω–¥—ñ–Ω

**–ó–Ω–∞—á–µ–Ω–Ω—è:** –¶–µ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ –¥—Ä—É–≥/–ø–æ–¥—Ä—É–≥–∞

### "Du hast keinen Grund, eifers√ºchtig zu sein"
**–í–∏–º–æ–≤–∞:** –î—É —Ö–∞—Å—Ç –∫–∞–π–Ω–µ–Ω “ë—Ä—É–Ω–¥, –∞–π—Ñ–µ—Ä–∑—é—Ö—Ç—ñ—Ö —Ü—É –∑–∞–π–Ω

**–ó–Ω–∞—á–µ–Ω–Ω—è:** –¢–æ–±—ñ –Ω–µ–º–∞ —á–æ–≥–æ —Ä–µ–≤–Ω—É–≤–∞—Ç–∏

### "Du bist der/die Einzige f√ºr mich"
**–í–∏–º–æ–≤–∞:** –î—É –±—ñ—Å—Ç –¥–µ—Ä/–¥—ñ –∞–π–Ω—Ü—ñ“ë–µ —Ñ—é—Ä –º—ñ—Ö

**–ó–Ω–∞—á–µ–Ω–Ω—è:** –¢–∏ ‚Äî —î–¥–∏–Ω–∏–π/—î–¥–∏–Ω–∞ –¥–ª—è –º–µ–Ω–µ

## –û–±–≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–µ–Ω–Ω—è

### "K√∂nnen wir dar√ºber reden?"
**–í–∏–º–æ–≤–∞:** –ö—å–æ–Ω–Ω–µ–Ω –≤—ñ—Ä –¥–∞—Ä—é–±–µ—Ä —Ä–µ–¥–µ–Ω?

**–ó–Ω–∞—á–µ–Ω–Ω—è:** –ß–∏ –º–æ–∂–µ–º–æ –º–∏ –ø–æ–≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç–∏ –ø—Ä–æ —Ü–µ?

### "Ich brauche, dass du ehrlich zu mir bist"
**–í–∏–º–æ–≤–∞:** –Ü—Ö –±—Ä–∞—É—Ö–µ, –¥–∞—Å –¥—É –µ—Ä–ª—ñ—Ö —Ü—É –º—ñ—Ä –±—ñ—Å—Ç

**–ó–Ω–∞—á–µ–Ω–Ω—è:** –ú–µ–Ω—ñ –ø–æ—Ç—Ä—ñ–±–Ω–æ, —â–æ–± —Ç–∏ –±—É–≤/–±—É–ª–∞ —á–µ—Å–Ω–∏–º/—á–µ—Å–Ω–æ—é

### "Ich arbeite an meiner Eifersucht"
**–í–∏–º–æ–≤–∞:** –Ü—Ö –∞—Ä–±–∞–π—Ç–µ –∞–Ω –º–∞–π–Ω–µ—Ä –∞–π—Ñ–µ—Ä–∑—É—Ö—Ç

**–ó–Ω–∞—á–µ–Ω–Ω—è:** –Ø –ø—Ä–∞—Ü—é—é –Ω–∞–¥ —Å–≤–æ—ó–º–∏ —Ä–µ–≤–Ω–æ—â–∞–º–∏

## –ö—É–ª—å—Ç—É—Ä–Ω—ñ –ø–æ—Ä–∞–¥–∏

**–ü—Ä—è–º–æ—Ç–∞:** –ù—ñ–º—Ü—ñ —Ü—ñ–Ω—É—é—Ç—å –ø—Ä—è–º–∏–π –ø—ñ–¥—Ö—ñ–¥ –¥–æ –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º.

**–û—Å–æ–±–∏—Å—Ç–∏–π –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç—ñ—Ä:** –ö–æ–Ω—Ç—Ä–æ–ª—å –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω–µ—Ä–∞ –Ω–µ —Å—Ö–≤–∞–ª—é—î—Ç—å—Å—è.

**–ß–µ—Å–Ω—ñ—Å—Ç—å:** "Ehrlichkeit" ‚Äî –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–∞ –Ω—ñ–º–µ—Ü—å–∫–∏—Ö —Å—Ç–æ—Å—É–Ω–∫—ñ–≤.

**–¢–µ—Ä–∞–ø—ñ—è:** –ó–≤–µ—Ä–Ω–µ–Ω–Ω—è –¥–æ –ø—Å–∏—Ö–æ–ª–æ–≥–∞ ‚Äî –Ω–æ—Ä–º–∞–ª—å–Ω–∞ –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏–∫–∞.

–ó–¥–æ—Ä–æ–≤–∞ –∫–æ–º—É–Ω—ñ–∫–∞—Ü—ñ—è ‚Äî –∫–ª—é—á –¥–æ –ø–æ–¥–æ–ª–∞–Ω–Ω—è —Ä–µ–≤–Ω–æ—â—ñ–≤.
